title: Brighton to Stonehenge
description: If you love to explore and experience nature away from the crowds, this is the ultimate sustainable holiday for you. Starting in Brighton, you'll collect a state-of-the-art luxury conversion campervan and you'll explore the best the South Downs has to offer.
about: If you love to explore and experience nature away from the crowds, this is the ultimate sustainable holiday for you. Starting in Brighton, you'll collect a state-of-the-art luxury conversion campervan. Provided with a guide filled with the best routes, activities, and campsites. You'll explore the best the South Downs has to offer. We arrange accommodation and experiences based on your plans and your preferences.
highlights: Stunning routes taking you through nature
Beautiful electric charging points to recharge and relax

days.description:
Arrive at Brighton train station in the morning. Wander through the bustling North Laine, famous for it’s independent stores.Have brunch at the independent Redroaster - one of the top 20 sustainable business in the UK.

 Stroll past the iconic Palace Pier along the seafront to collect your electric campervan. Your home on wheels. We’ll talk you through all the features.

From there, drive along the stunning sunny coastline, driving upwards towards Lewes.

thingsToDo.text: Grab some fresh bread from The Flint Owl bakery, we recommend the rosemary and sea salt sourdough
Go for a outdoor swim in Pells Pool
Pop into the Needlemakers. It’s full of local, ethical, independent shops

accomodation.title: Wild Willows Campsite
accomodation.description: A beautiful Eco-Campsite in the heart of Sussex at the foot of the South Downs. Walking distance from Lewes.

days.description:
Head north from Lewes and join the A272 heading west. This road will become your new best friend over the next few days.

Be sure to stop at Bolney Wine Estate, accredited by Sustainable Wines of Great Britain and they have a solar powered EV charging point

thingsToDo.text: Monks House, Virginia Woolf's 16th-century country retreat

extras.text: A wine and food tasting tour at Bolney Wine Estate

accomodation.title: Cattlestone Farm
accomodation.description: Glamping surrounded by arces of wild flower meadows and highland heifers!

days.description:
Wake up on Cattlestone Farm and drive to Knepp Castle estate for an incredible wildlife safari from one of the leading rewilding projects in the world.

From there, head west through Petworth and Midhurst. This route is beautiful.

thingsToDo.text: Take a walk around Knepp Estate’s public footpaths
Visit The Hungry Guest Cafe in Petworth to stock up on supplies
Visit the South Downs National Park centre

days.description:
Wake up to the sounds of birds at Brocklands farm, travel past Winchester and through Stockbridge, a love town with a crystal clear stream running though it.

Stop and charge at the Red Lion pub car park (open to non-customers) and take a strolls through Stockbridge and the surrounding countryside.

Head towards Stonehenge.

thingsToDo.text: Lunch at Prego Deli in Stockbridge, authentic Italian cooking

days.description:
Wake up at the crack of dawn and marvel at Stonehenge, still standing after 3500 years.

You’ll then head back along the A272, passing through Stockbridge and camping at  Brocklands Farm

thingsToDo.text: Lunch at Prego Deli in Stockbridge, authentic Italian cooking
